It physically hurts to loose late game stages of Brotato run due to your own stupidity and false impression of own immortality, the pain lingers for hours and the disappointment haunts you for days, you wake up in cold sweat and remember that perfect RNG you had with items, levels and how splendidly you screwed everything up.
[i]10 points of self-hatred and inner pain out of 10.[/i]

On a more serious note... The game is really great. 
[u][b]Music[/b][/u] is amazing, very energetic and puts you in the right mood for the game. Game sounds are very comfy and nice.
[u][b]Visually[/b][/u] the game is very eye-pleasing: animations are very simple, they don't distract you, as it should be, everything looks very smooth and polished.
[u][b]Gameplay[/b][/u] COULD seem repetetive, BUT you actually have a lot of options how play:
[olist]
   1) there are bunch of weapon types and weapon classes, each one is unique. Weapons have on hit effects, kill effects, knockback, class bonuses(2-6 of the same type will provide you additional stats, for example), different range and number of projectiles, projectiles can pierce, ricochet, melee weapons can hit multiple target in one swing etc. You can be melee, ranged or you can play around turrets and mines, you can focus on elemental\magic dmg. You can choose weapons that deal dmg based on your HP...;
[/olist]
[olist]
   2) there are bunch of characters, or better to say BROTATOS, each with it's own specialty and playstyle. You normaly can have 6 weapons, but there are characters who can't have weapons, but they explode when hit, some can have only 1 weapon, some 12, there is even a Pacifist Brotato, who benefits from not killing enemies!;
[/olist]
[olist]
   3) each time you complete a level you get to choose how to lvl up and what to buy and you never have the same run;
[/olist]
[olist]
   4) there is an endless mode c:
[/olist]

[u][b]Conclusion:[/b][/u]
For me it's a mustplay game from the genre, very enjoyable to watch and to play.
Definitely recommend to everyone who enjoys this type of games.
Not easy, not insanely hard. Good balance.

This is one of the best games in the "wave survivor" genre. The amount of characters, items and mechanics not only allow for diverse gameplay, but requires it. In Vampire Survivors, after unlocking most of the characters, I felt like I was going for the same build in every run, independent of the character and map I was playing. In Brotato that is not possible: most characters have their own restrictive weaknesses and strengths, making some builds inviable for them in exchange for making other builds exclusive.  It is quite unique.

An RPG twin-stick looter shooter, with a card game-style drawing of good and bad attributes. Pick the best combos you can each round, fine-tune your build, and face off with six (or 12!) weapons simultaneously! It's a weird hybrid of game genres and styles, but it works. Add in additional cards and characters that unlock as you progress and it's absolutely addicting!

Don't think of it as a SHMUP or a Vampire Survivors clone - it's actually the perfect distillation of an aRPG with stat choices, equipment choices, and meaningful decisions made throughout. And unlike most aRPGs which drown you in stats but rarely give you meaningful information about the decisions you make, Brotato gives the perfect amount of detail to help you learn. I never knew I needed to know how many kills each weapon had until a game told me, and now I wish every game had it. Would be a bargain at five times the price, don't hesitate, buy it now.

Short version if you looking for reviews to know if this game is as good as Vampire Survivors, the answer is a sounding YES, some what more fun.

After a while, with all the progression, Vampire Survivors becomes a bit boring, with no challenge and basically an achievement hunt process. 

Brotato's characters are more varied, with even a small learning curve on how to play each one of them properly, and you can experiment with different builds on same characters upgrading different stats/skills. With no meta progression, aside of unlocking new weapons and characters, the game is still challenging even on Danger Level 0, even after unlocking everything.

It's simple and very fun. Go for it!

Brotato is a delightful top-down arena shooter roguelite that offers a unique and entertaining experience. Controlling a potato armed with up to 6 weapons adds a charming twist to the gameplay. The diverse traits and items allow for the creation of exciting and varied builds, ensuring each playthrough feels fresh. The vibrant visuals, creative enemy design, and adrenaline-pumping soundtrack contribute to the game's overall appeal. With its perfect blend of challenge and fun, Brotato is a must-play for fans of the genre.
Probably one of the only games I actually sat down and was determined to get every character and unlock. It was worth it.

Fun game. Pretty addicting. I don't think it's in the top tier of Vampire Survivor type clones, but it's pretty close. It's very much stat based, especially with all the classes. You have to know what everything does, even when it's not explained properly and knowing the optimal strategy for each scenario (class) is paramount. Also, you're just really moving around in circles for the most part. The game is 80% strategy, 20% execution (gameplay). 

You can make some pretty broken builds if the RNG gods are with you. You can also just suddenly die because you didn't have enough dodge or armor or HP or some stat that just never came up. Maybe you're just too broke to buy that one upgrade that you needed. This game is perfect for mathematicians / statisticians ... honestly a college course on this game would make math a lot more interesting.

I can't believe I'm saying this but... Brotato  has completely blown me away! This game took me on an adrenaline-fueled journey unlike any other. From choosing my character with their unique stats to battling increasingly powerful monsters through 20 intense rounds, the thrill never let up.

The strategic element of the game is what truly hooked me. With each round presenting tougher challenges, the need to upgrade and fine-tune my character's stats became a thrilling necessity. The balance between earning money and deciding where to invest it for maximum impact kept me engaged and strategizing every step of the way.

The rush of excitement as I faced the final boss on round 20 was unparalleled. The satisfaction of using my hard-earned upgrades to conquer the ultimate challenge was incredibly rewarding.

Brotato isn't just about battling monsters; it's a test of wit, strategy, and resource management. The escalating difficulty curve adds a layer of excitement and accomplishment with each victorious round.

In summary, Brotato is a five-star triumph in the gaming world. Its unique blend of strategy, character development, and thrilling battles makes it an absolute must-play for anyone seeking an adrenaline rush and a truly epic gaming experience.

I think I prefer this to Vampire Survivors. (It's natural to compare this to VS; both are roguelike bullet heaven/hell games). I'd say Brotato is a much better game with far more depth and challenge than VS as you really need to think about the upgrades and statistics and how they will interact with each other. Add into this mix all of the different characters at your disposal, and you have hundreds of different builds with which you can try to beat the game. Also, if you don't like the auto-aim feature of games like VS and don't find that very engaging, you can turn it off and aim manually to ramp up the challenge even more. Also the music slaps.

Brotato delivers a  unique gaming experience a cross between ye-old gauntlet and the top down plane/space shooter games. The graphics are unique and innovative with your potato showing the items they have upgraded with after each wave of monsters. 

The game retains enough replay-ability to keep you coming back for more to try and puzzle out the correct weapon/item combination for a particular potato to beat/survive to wave 20. Well worth the $8 purchase price and easy to pickup and play at anytime and as a bonus has fairly light system needs to evenn runs on my old potato of a laptop (circa 2015).

Great game. Game play is tight. Lots of characters and different builds are possible. There is no permanent progression so your stats don't go up by just playing the game. Instead you improve by playing the game and gaining knowledge about the enemies, weapons, items, shop and how the stats work. A run is 20 waves each increasing in length and harder enemies. There are six difficulty levels available Danger 0 to 5. You can also play endless mode.

В игре неплохой баланс и на первых порах забега нужно выбирать 1 из 2. 
1) забить хрен на один и/или несколько параметров
2) попытаться усидеть на всех стульях. 
И оба варианта вполне играбельны хотя имхо, под конец всё-равно нужно будет следовать 2 варианту и бо это vampire-like а в них если в лейте тебе не хватает чего-либо то в основном это тебя и убивает. 
Благо перекос можно спокойно убрать вол эдак за 6-10 (смотря на сколько он сильный. Есть и пара исключений, например призрак или пацифист. 

Ну и раз подняли тему классов/персонажей то самое время и о них что-нибудь сказать. Персонажей/классов в игре аж 34 и каждый реально играется по-своему. есть например пацифист который получает материалы за каждого живого врага в конце волны, или стрелок который не может использовать оружия ближнего боя, или призрак у которого -100 броня(больше урона получает), но +30% к уклонению и вместо 60% потолок уклонения 90%. И вот так с каждым персонажем что очень хорошо.

Ну и про материалы. Они выпадают с мобов и получаются за разбор вещей из ящиков(покупные нельзя разобрать)и разбор оружия. Есть и исключения, к примеру ранее названый пацифист, но суть ресурса одна. По окончанию волны открывается магазин где можно купить новое оружие/копию своего/предметы. 

Большинство предметов дают что-то и забирают что-то другое, например +2к броне -1% к скорости, или +8% к уклонению -1 к броне, но усидеть на всех стульях вполне реально. 

Теперь о пушках и зачем нужны их клоны. А нужны они для смешивания непосредственно апа пушки этим путём. смешать можно только 2 полностью одинаковые пушки и получить 1 более высокого уровня. Уровней пушек всего 4. (кстати и у обычной прокачки за лвл есть уровни, их тоже 4) максимум пушек 6, но и тут есть исключение. 

Так же игра не дает стоять на месте, враги появляются в разных точках карты, а не из углов экрана что местами заставляет ходить по карте. 

Ну в целом вроде рассказал о всё о чем можно было, однозначно рекомендую

This game is actively trying to destroy its own playerbase. Everytime someone finds a good build the dev nerfs it into oblivion. I have never seen a dev misunderstand its own customer base so badly. The whole point of this game is to play over and over untill you get a good run with great RNG so you can push further and further. The dev will intentionally nerf items and change stat values to stop you from doing that. There is literally no point in playing as you will inevitably run into a wall where you simply cant keep up with the buffs the enemies get. You cannot get better at the game. You cannot get a lucky run. This is because any item in the game that works will be nerfed beyond useless. Any strategy you develop will only serve to inspire the Dev to nerf or otherwise sabotage that method.

 Why would I be motivated to play again for a better run when I know the run will die because the game suspiciously suddenly stops giving legendary drops despite my luck stat being through the roof? Why would you punish players that want to go into wave 100? This isnt a competitive game. It has no esports scene. There is literally no reason to balance the fun out of the game. Understand that its not a skill issue. The game now has mechanics in place to kill runs for the sake of killing runs. You cannot get better to counter this its hard coded.

Brotato became popular because of the broken builds. Thats why people loved it. You could get good at the game and push for a good run and become a potato god. Now you die on wave 36 with an overpowered build because the game refuses to drop the items you need to keep up. You heard me right. Its not an RNG thing. It is literally designed to stonewall you. Brotato is boring now.

God I love this game. Responsive snappy combat, plays great on a controller, satisfying kills, good upgrades, and so many achievements.

What a small but amazing game. It has a very addictive gameplay loop where you have to kill enemies on a small map, collecting currency which you then spend on weapon/defense and other upgrades. There's also a boss at the end. I thought after finishing it once that I wouldn't want to continue but it gives you another hook - you are progressing with your character and unlocking new characters so you can try different combinations of characters and abilities.

If you like games like Vampire Survivors, try this!
If you want a game that doesn't take hours to finish, try this!
If you want some adrenaline gameplay, try this!
If you want good reward system by playing and mastering the game, try this!

For a game in the "Walk n' grind" genre it's pretty great. It's like Vampire Survivors, but each round is about a minute long, the map is much smaller, and artstyle is similar to Binding of Issac in a way. It's pretty fun and you unlock different characters/items instead of permanent upgrades when you win a round which I prefer. 

Only complaints I have are minor. Elemental feels very weak compared to other weapons/stats. There is also a specific boss in the game that is crazy hard to beat compared to the other bosses I have faced throughout the game (Butcher). Finally if you are after a game with more control to it you won't find it here. What I mean is the only control you have is your movement with no way to aim or fire your weapon since it's done automatically.

Overall as a game to play while listening to music or watching YouTube vids this was certainly worth it! 9/10

Brotato is genius and I loved it both on Android and on PC.

"Unearth the Spud-tacular Fun: A Brotato Review"

Brotato isn't your average run-of-the-mill roguelite game; it's a delightful journey into a potato-infused universe where the stakes are as high as the starch content. As a roguelite aficionado, I found myself enamored with the tuberous charm of Brotato and here’s why this game is worth every peeler's time.

A Quirky Concept with Stellar Execution:
Brotato takes a whimsical premise and executes it with a finesse that's as smooth as mashed potatoes. Armed with an arsenal of up to six weapons, you, a combat-ready potato, face off against relentless alien invasions in a top-down arena. The crisp execution of this concept kept me engaged and eager for more.

Potato Power: The Art of Customization:
The game allows you to tailor your potato to your preferred style of gameplay. With a variety of traits and items to choose from, the customization options are as vast as a field of Idaho Russets. Whether you want to be an explosive spud or a stealthy tater, Brotato accommodates your strategic desires.

Roguelite Done Right:
The roguelite elements in Brotato are as integral as gravy on poutine. Each run feels unique with procedurally generated levels, diverse enemy patterns, and randomized item placements. The constant companion of permadeath doesn't feel punishing but instead drives the motivation to adapt and strive for that better run.

Tater-tainment Galore:
The humor in Brotato is a hearty serving of fun. From the clever item descriptions to the playful enemy designs, the game exudes a light-heartedness that's refreshing. It's a game that doesn’t take itself too seriously, making it accessible and enjoyable for both casual and hardcore gamers.

A Visual Feast of Potato Goodness:
With its vibrant, pixelated art style and a clear top-down perspective, Brotato is a visual delight. The quirky design of aliens and smooth animations add to the visual appeal, making the chaotic battles a sight to behold.

Spud-tacular Challenges and Achievements:
For the completionists out there, Brotato offers an array of challenges and achievements that are as satisfying as achieving the perfect roastie. The potato-themed challenges extend the game’s longevity and provide a satisfying crunch of accomplishment.

Room for Improvement?
Every game has room for growth, and Brotato is no exception. Some might find the difficulty to be a bit challenging, and a dash of diversity in level environments and enemy types could be the extra seasoning this game needs.

In Conclusion:
Brotato is a spud-tacular roguelite arena shooter that serves up a unique blend of humor, challenging gameplay, and customization. Whether you're a roguelite veteran or just on the lookout for a quirky game to dig into, Brotato has got the goods to keep you coming back for more. So gear up, grab your potato-themed weaponry, and get ready for a spud-fueled adventure that's anything but half-baked!

If you love the genre like(Vampire Survivor) I would recommend this game, if you only 'like' the genre like me, I would say you can skip this one. It just doesn't get as crazy and OP like I was hoping it would and I've beaten difficulty 2.

The game is addictive in a fun pick-up-and-play way. It has excellent music, and an enjoyable gameplay loop that has a surprising amount of headroom for skill growth in terms of picking your powerups and utilising movement. When you hit a difficulty ceiling and your progress plateaus however, the game edges into frustrating time-waster territory. 

But despite issues peaks and troughs of progress, and some truly brutal difficulty the higher you go, it is hard to put down as the sense that your next bit of progress is just over the horizon exists perpetually. 

Is this manipulative? Yep. But while it's harmless fun, it's very accessible harmless fun.

Worth the entry price.

Score: 9/10

You have up to an hour and don't know what to play? Play Brotato. This game is so fun that it's hard for me to explain it by words. You get a huge variety of characters, many different weapons, items, perks, skills. It feels great when you realize how strong you are becoming each wave. It was so fun that I bet the game with every character, completed every achievement and I don't regret spending any minute in this game (other than playing fisherman, that was... stressful).
4/5. This game is a solid bullet hell roguelite. Very fun for very cheap.
This is quite addictive. A good and fun game!
Addicting gameplay and a huge variety of different builds and characters. 10/10 if you like games like Vampire Survivors.
Pleasant progression. Smooth. Creative chars and gear. Great on Deck and controllers.
Vampire Survivors is excellent, but I prefer this.
This game is easy to learn, hard to master. So much depth for a simple potato!

Fuck this game ... it's incredible frustrating, and you'll feel like you have wasted your life playing a stupid game. 

Then, you'll do one more run... then another ... 

This game is more about inventory planning as opposed to raw skill. Once you understand how to great the best load out for a particular character, then the game becomes a lot more reasonable.
Very fun game. Have lots of studying to do? Play this instead!
